Class KryoMessage

java.lang.Object
common.KryoMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class KryoMessage extends Object implements Serializable
A lightweight transport wrapper used to send Kryo-serialized data between client and server.

KryoMessage encapsulates a raw byte payload produced by KryoUtil together with a simple string type identifier. It is used as the low-level network message that actually travels over the socket.

In this project, KryoMessage is typically used to wrap an Envelope instance after it has been serialized to bytes. The type field allows quick identification of the message category before deserialization.

This class is intentionally minimal and immutable to ensure safe transport across the network.

See Also:

    • payloadObject

      public <T> T payloadObject()
      Deserializes the payload back into an object.

      The caller is responsible for knowing the expected object type.

      Type Parameters:

      Returns:
      deserialized object
